author: marekm3498
content: Which clients have not provided benchmarks? I have already seen benchmarks from Besu, Nethermind, and Geth, but I want to ensure I am not missing anything.

author: jochembrouwer
content: For the 7702 change (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8969),  I think it is safe to assume that code starting with 0xef0100 is always a delegated account by 7702, right? (And for completeness: only for mainnet, and for other chains which do not have pre-allocated 0xef0100 and have EIP 3541 active). (I am 99% convinced about this but just wanted to get a confirm here ðŸ™‚ )

author: jochembrouwer
content: <@411317441688371202> (and others) could you check my comment on returning 3 on EXTCODESIZE? https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8969/files#r1857205755

author: jochembrouwer
content: The designator is defined in the EIP as `0xef0100`, but in the explanation of EXTCODE* behavior it is now `0xef01` ðŸ¤”

author: _shemnon
content: I would prefer the three byte version as a forward looking request, so potential future delegate variants can be distinguished. see EIP-7819 - https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7819

author: jochembrouwer
content: Cool. My preference also goes to the 3 bytes ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: However if we introduce versioning (which is a nice feature of the 3 bytes) then this means if you update the delegation to a new version, then EXTCODECOPY and EXTCODEHASH will yield different outputs

author: jochembrouwer
content: So for UX, to check if an account is then delegated EXTCODECOPY(0,2) and verify this is `0xef01`

author: frangio_
content:
note that the spec does say "the first 2 bytes of the designator" so i don't think there's an inconsistency or ambiguity there

on whether to make that the first 3 bytes i don't have a very strong opinion, but i think 2 bytes is more aligned with EOF contracts whose observable code is 0xef00, not including the version byte

author: frangio_
content: this seems more aligned with removing avenues for introspection

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Ah woops, I just saw that I misread the EIP. For some reason I interpreted "the first 2 bytes of the designator (`0xef01`)" as "the designator is `0xef01`".

You are right, EOF has the first 2 bytes also, I initially thought it would be a good idea to use the whole designator (so also the extra 0 byte which could change in the future) but that would not mitigate the problem here. So yes it's all fine

author: jochembrouwer
content: I will update my comment on the PR ðŸ™‚

author: fluffducks
content: Hihi, i'm trying to deploy contracts on Mekong testnet but noticed txs are not confirming. Last tx on https://explorer.mekong.ethpandaops.io/ says 9hours ago. How are folks working around this? Thank you!
